ui

Class Connect4Gui

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.application.Application
      • ui.Connect4Gui
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    UI

    public class Connect4Gui
extends javafx.application.Application
implements UI
    The GUI for the Connect 4 game for the Connect4 game
    Version:
    2/9/20
    Author:
    Ryan Cluff, rpcluff, rpcluff@asu.edu

    • Field Detail

      • boardUI

        private Connect4Gui.Cell[][] boardUI
        The board represented by a 2D array of custom panes. The idea to implement the board this way was from the tictactoe.java example

      • buttons

        private javafx.scene.control.Button[] buttons
        An array of buttons to indicate the players column selection

      • client

        private Connect4Client client
        The object representing the model of the game

      • isGameOver

        private boolean isGameOver
        Indicates if the game is over (Has been won or tied)

      • status

        private javafx.scene.control.Label status
        The status label at the bottom of the ui. Used to indicate turns and if the game has been won or tied.

      • getComputer

        public boolean getComputer()
        Description copied from interface: UI
        Prints a welcome message to the users and prompts whether the game will be 1 player or 2 player
        Specified by:
        getComputer in interface UI
        Returns:
        true if the player wants to play against a computer, false if against another player
